data.Hierarchy for Procurements and Requisiti: *Loan eligibility based on last paid loan and employment tenure
** Loans up to PKR 50,000 require HR & CFO approval
*** Each role must complete its action Max 24 working hours, minimum it will take 2 to 3 hours for execution

data.Standard Operating Procedure (SOP): This SOP defines the standardized process for initiating, reviewing, approving, and executing procurement and requisition requests to ensure transparency, control, and timely processing across the organization.

This SOP applies to all employees, departments, and management involved in requisition and procurement activities, including loans, advance salaries, events, IT equipment, devices, and general procurements.
Employee: Initiates requisition requests with complete justification.
Head of Department (HOD): Reviews and initiates requests where applicable.
Admin: Takes action on approved requisitions and coordinates documentation.
HR / CFO: Reviews and approves financial matters (as per limits).
Procurement Committee: Reviews technical and financial feasibility where required.
Procurement Team: Collects quotations and executes approved procurements.
CEO: Provides final approval where applicable.
CEO: Approval required for amounts above PKR 50,000
CEO: Approval required for amounts above PKR 50,000
4.5 Specialized Projects / IT Equipment / General Procurements / Devices & Accessories
Procurement Committee: Review technical & financial cost
Each stakeholder must complete their assigned role within 24 hours of receiving the request.
Loan eligibility is based on the last paid loan and employment period.
Loans up to PKR 50,000 require HR & CFO approval.
All approvals must be documented and archived for audit purposes.

Start → Employee Raises Requisition → HOD Review / Initiation → Admin / HR-CFO Review (if applicable) → Procurement Committee Review (Technical & Financial – if applicable) → Procurement Team Collects Quotations → CEO Approval → Procurement Team Executes Purchase → End
All procurement and requisition activities must comply with this SOP. Any deviation requires written approval from the CEO and CFO. Records must be retained for audit and compliance purposes.
